Trojan!  Don't pay any attention to anyone saying it's a "false positive." It knocked-out avast! & microsoft security essentials after a reboot, causes Win7x64 to hang for about an hour during boot, and fucks-up a bunch of .dlls.  I tried it on several VMs and avast!, avira, & comodo missed it.  MSE & kaspersky caught it though, and both say it's Obfuscator.XZ. (Yes, I know what that is & that it can have legitimate uses.  Not in this case, though.)  Just trying to warn everyone.  Unless you really want to wipe your HDDs & re-install, leave this one alone & keep Shift2 un-updated.  If you think I'm lying, go ahead and get it.  I don't care. Enjoy the mess this will make of your PC.  To everyone that installed it & thinks there are no problems, I'd just go ahead & wipe my HDDs if I were you.  I haven't had a chance to really dig into what this does yet, but whatever it is, it's nothing good.
